industrial.translation[0].definitions[0]: relating to industry or the people working in it
Industrial production has risen by 0.5% since November.
Last year 1.3 million workers took part in industrial disputes.
industrial.translation[0].definitions[1]: By 1900, Britain was a mainly industrial society.
a meeting of the world’s major industrial nations
industrial.translation[0].definitions[2]: of the type used in industry
cleaning products that are for industrial use only  (=not to be used at home)
industrial.translation[1].definitions[0]: big industrial companies such as Fiat S.p.A
The industrial sector remained weak at the end of the first quarter.
China’s industrial output dropped sharply after floods stopped production in many factories.
industrial.translation[1].definitions[1]: having many industries, or industries that are well developed
The industrial nations are less dependent on oil than they were a decade ago.
the industrial heartland (=the part where there is most industry) of Southern California
industrial.translation[1].definitions[2]: of the type used in industry
a company that sells industrial fire alarms.
companies with big interests in industrial chemicals
industrial products such as cooling and heating equipment
